problem_text:
What are the chief factors of a finite group in which every 2-maximal subgroup is not m-maximal for any m ⩾ 3?
A subgroup H of a group G is said to be m-maximal if there is a chain of subgroups
H = H0 < H1 < . . . < Hm−1 < Hm = G
in which Hi is maximal in Hi+1 for every i.
Note that for every m ⩾ 3 there is a finite group in which some 2-maximal subgroup is m-maximal.
V. S. Monakhov
